verses.verse: And when they arose early the next morning, there was Dagon, fallen on its face to the ground before the ark of the LORD. (Is. 46:7) The head of Dagon and both the palms of its hands were broken off on the threshold; only Dagon’s torso was left of it.
Therefore neither the priests of Dagon nor any who come into Dagon’s house (Jer. 50:2; Ezek. 6:4, 6; Mic. 1:7) tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod to this day.

But the (Zeph. 1:9) hand of the LORD was heavy on the people of Ashdod, and He (Ex. 9:3; Deut. 2:15; 1 Sam. 5:7; 7:13; Ps. 32:4; 145:20; 147:6) ravaged them and struck them with (1 Sam. 6:5) tumors, both Ashdod and its (Deut. 28:27; Ps. 78:66) territory.
And when the men of Ashdod saw how it was, they said, “The ark of the (Josh. 15:46, 47) God of Israel must not remain with us, for His hand is harsh toward us and Dagon our god.”

Therefore they sent and gathered to themselves all the (1 Sam. 6:5) lords of the Philistines, and said, “What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel?” And they answered, “Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried away to (1 Sam. 6:4) Gath.” So they carried the ark of the God of Israel away.

So it was, after they had carried it away, that (Josh. 11:22) the hand of the LORD was against the city with a very great destruction; and He struck the men of the city, both small and great, and tumors broke out on them.

Therefore they sent the ark of God to Ekron. So it was, as the ark of God came to Ekron, that the Ekronites cried out, saying, “They have brought the ark of the God of Israel to us, to kill us and our people!”

So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and said, “Send away the ark of the God of Israel, and let it go back to its own place, so that it does not kill us and our people.” For there was a deadly destruction throughout all the city; the hand of God was very heavy there.
And the men who did not die were stricken with the tumors, and the (Deut. 2:15; 1 Sam. 5:11; 7:13; 12:15) cry of the city went up to heaven.
The Ark Returned to Israel Now the ark of the LORD was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
And the Philistines (1 Sam. 9:16; Jer. 14:2) called for the priests and the diviners, saying, “What shall we do with the ark of the LORD? Tell us how we should send it to its place.”

So they said, “If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it (Gen. 41:8; Ex. 7:11; Is. 2:6; 47:13; Dan. 2:2; 5:7) empty; but by all means return it to Him with (Ex. 23:15; Deut. 16:16) a trespass offering. Then you will be healed, and it will be known to you why His hand is not removed from you.”

Then they said, “What is the trespass offering which we shall return to Him?” They answered, (Lev. 5:15, 16) “Five golden tumors and five golden rats, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines. For the same plague was on all of you and on your lords.

Therefore you shall make images of your tumors and images of your rats that (1 Sam. 5:6, 9, 12; 6:17) ravage the land, and you shall (1 Sam. 5:6) give glory to the God of Israel; perhaps He will (Josh. 7:19; 1 Chr. 16:28, 29; Is. 42:12; Jer. 13:16; Mal. 2:2; Rev. 14:7) lighten His hand from you, from (1 Sam. 5:6, 11; Ps. 39:10) your gods, and from your land.

Why then do you harden your hearts (1 Sam. 5:3, 4, 7) as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When He did mighty things among them, (Ex. 7:13; 8:15; 9:34; 14:17) did they not let the people go, that they might depart?
Now therefore, make (Ex. 12:31) a new cart, take two milk cows (2 Sam. 6:3) which have never been yoked, and hitch the cows to the cart; and take their calves home, away from them.

Then take the ark of the LORD and set it on the cart; and put (Num. 19:2; Deut. 21:3, 4) the articles of gold which you are returning to Him as a trespass offering in a chest by its side. Then send it away, and let it go.

And watch: if it goes up the road to its own territory, to (1 Sam. 6:4, 5) Beth Shemesh, then He has done us this great evil. But if not, then (Josh. 15:10; 21:16) we shall know that it is not His hand that struck us—it happened to us by chance.”
Then the men did so; they took two milk cows and hitched them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home.
And they set the ark of the LORD on the cart, and the chest with the gold rats and the images of their tumors.

Then the cows headed straight for the road to Beth Shemesh, and went along the (1 Sam. 6:3) highway, lowing as they went, and did not turn aside to the right hand or the left. And the lords of the Philistines went after them to the border of Beth Shemesh.
